body.p: What is the difference between the two bar charts?

multiple_choice.choice: The two bar charts represent the distributions of two different variables.
The first bar chart represents the count of respondents that chose each category, while the second bar chart represents the percentage of respondents that chose each category.
The two bar charts represent the distribution of "Body Image" obtained from two different samples.

response.feedback: Incorrect. There is a difference between the two bar charts.

Incorrect. The two bar charts represent the distribution of the same variable. Both represent the variable that records the responses about body image (about right, overweight, underweight) for a sample of students.

Correct. The two bar charts are different because counts and percentages have different scales on the vertical axis. Counts have a scale from 0 to the total number of subjects, while percentages always have a scale from 0 to 100.
Incorrect. The two bar charts represent the distribution of "Body Image" obtained from one sample of students.

part.hint: Look at the vertical axis for each bar chart.
Notice that the vertical axis represents something different for each bar chart.
